R_32mYY-BXrhV5fdJirwDg.text: Let me start of by saying the food was absolutely exceptional and our waitress was very attentive and friendly!   The only reason for the 4 stars is the service we received from the hosts. We had reservations for 730pm and they did not seat us until 810pm. They said they were running a bit behind and couldn't give us a time frame for when we would be seated. Which is fine, I get things happen. BUT there was no apology on their delay, they didn't check up on us while we waited 40 min. And I made sure to call that day to confirm our reservations. They made it seem like we were inconveniencing them.   But once we sat down the service completely changed! The waitress was sooooo great! And the food amazing!:) definitely reccomend.

PwcMxZXE8IgAb-ZjAwXK6A.text: The BEST Churrascaria not just of Las Vegas but of all time over Texas de Brazil by far. We used to go to TDB all the time until a friend recommended us here so we gave it a try and I can't even begin to tell you how much of a difference it is in the meats and the service. Most of all service is 70% of what matters really also the food of course but how they treat you and the experience they give you is the real deal. Dined in with my wife and two other friends and we're right away greeted by our server Min and he was such a gentleman pulling out our wives chairs for them and ours as being seated. First impressions are very important and that alone already wowed us and we knew we were in for a treat. We started out with seafood as an appetizer that was just awesome because we didn't know such a steakhouse would have such a thing but it was a beautiful tower of lobster,crab, shrimp and mussels! Absolutely fantastic, than we moved on to their salad bar which is filled with such bright and tasteful fruits and salads and cheeses. Don't stuff yourself up on the salad now! Always remember why you're there and it's for the main course , the best of all is their steaks. Cut after cut was just pure perfection. The right temperature the right seasoning just perfection. We couldn't figure out why the meats were just so full of flavor as our server Min let us know that the meats are actually cooked from charcoal. Unlike almost every steakhouse now they cook their meats under propane gas, Fogo De Chao does NOT. No wonder why the meats are tender and juicy the way they are served table side and just right off the grill. You can taste the smoke in the meats! All the meat carvers were all great with such big smiles on their faces and always were so accommodating with  getting three different temperatures of meat to our table with no hassle at all. Thumbs up to our server he always made sure we got exactly what we wanted and never had to wait for anything. I love how everyone here does NOT treat you like they have to do what you want or ask for. Phenomenal service from when you first sit down until you walk out their doors. Worth the visit and highly recommended! Will be telling everyone about our wonderful night there.

ITvfDrRYMS6pfVOlJ0DJbA.text: This place is a joke. We made a reservation for 7 and when we arrived we do get seated right away. We were seated near the entrance to the kitchen so we see the meat coming out. Waiter told us there were 66 different types of meat. We were excited to try them! night we tried about 6 different types of meat. We saw other types of meats leave the kitchen but never reached our table.    The side dishes were bland and gross. I gave this place a one star because at least the waiter was nice and helpful. After tax and tip. It was $70, what a waste of money.  And to make matters worse, I got food poisoning from this place. I was stuck in the bathroom all night!  Kevin C from Yelp decided to call me dumb and stupid because he states I heard wrong about the 66 types of meat, there were 7 of us! We all heard the same thing, I didnt believe the waiter and obviously there wasnt. Yes I'm stupid and dumb for eating at this place, another yelp fail & disappointment!

IUtNZvf_SlGMmAmviqeXlw.text: Still no apology from manager or anything. I guess this place loves to hire RUDE staff. Perhaps there are no good female employees in Vegas; they must all have OTHER types of jobs. I WILL NOT GO HERE nor recommend this place. In fact, a month ago we were looking for a place to celebrate my cousin's birthday and I absolutely refused to go here. We went to a restaurant with a proven reputation and polite staff!!

rwhDDlJiAn0rQ87ao6ykYg.text: Great service and great food. Sign up for the emails to get discount coupons.

Sqxz9d6qa-GjDzch7qZVWw.text: Good food. I went in for lunch and they have a cery nice variety. I would definitely recommend it and go back.

Uwwnh3b_YSuJ7UZKSbzW_A.text: A pretty unique experience. The salad bar that is included with the meal is great; there is a huge assortment but pace yourself because you're obviously here for the meat! A bunch of different people came to the table with sticks of meat varying from different cuts of beef, to chicken, to pork and lamb. The meat was pretty tasty and my favorite was the house sirloin!!! Service was great, very personable and friendly. The manager came around to each table also which is nice as he checked in with how you were enjoying the experience and food. Easy to get full here so come hungry!

9ubbhJSSi52d9xMVX1C-rg.text: Went there with the family for brunch on a Saturday and it was absolutely amazing. The cheese balls were fresh and warm. I am a pescetarian but the manager Kappa offered me a seafood tower with shrimp and crab that was delicious! Salad bar has lots of options and the rest of the fam really enjoyed the variety of meats!

Nc45Jp2pRnZZVJJ9b0edlQ.text: I'm not much for AYCE but Fogo de Chao gets my vote.  It's a Brazilian steakhouse so you can't really go wrong unless you happen to be a vegetarian.  First of all, we got an awesome deal through Yelp Spring Break.  $37 per person instead of the normal $48 per person.  Win!  The salad bar is just that, vegetables, salads, some amazing burrata mozzarella, shaved parmesan, and sides.  I usually try not to fill up on those things but the burrata was delicious.  I tried most of the meats.  I didn't try the chicken.  I loved the house special Picanha, filet mignon, lamb, ribeye and pork.  So much meat.  Give me more!    I loved the chimichurri sauce they brought out.  We wanted a bucketful, it was so good.  The cheesy rolls were to die for.  I do recommend you trying those cheesy rolls though.  I love that they bring all the meat to you and slice it onto your plate.  If you need them to stop just flip your card from green to red.  Super simple.  Need them to bring more meat, then flip it back to green.  The servers are really conscientious about the colors and will even bring by any special meats that you request.  Some are circulated more than others so all you have to do is ask.  I have to say it ranks as one of the best meals I've ever had in Vegas without breaking the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EzEYprMN6Akv7vs7m0_0uA.text: I like a good piece of meat every once in a while, but man this place is MEAT OVERLOAD!!! The Gauchos that work here are really Brazilians from Brazil that cook and serve you generous portions of the 15 types of meat here. a bunch of us decided to take advantage of the Yelp Spring Break offer and dine in for $37.  There are many great items available at their salad bar, but you want to be very careful and not fill up on these items, because the meats and sides are where its at. my favorite meats were the Bone-in Lamb Chop and the Pichana. The sides(Potatoes, Polenta, and Plantains) were a perfect compliment to the well seasoned meats, and the Cheese Bread? Totally addicting!  The color cards....you're gonna have to play "Red Light, Green Light" with these Gauchos because if you just leave it green side up, they will bombard you with their meat rods like teeny-bopper girls trying to get Justin Bieber's autograph! Just Sayin'.......ALOHA!!!  YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(271/365) " A Carniwhore's Heaven!"

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pichana
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sides
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6hkfUKyF7GaIMK_uZdRxPw.text: You can't go wrong with this place , Wonderful food , Service and Price . Picanha is on point , beef ribs amazing . Bathrooms are kind of dirty . I would love to have a bigger salad bar with more cheese and other options

_wDsabV7m2mK13AbyPeNxw.text: We had a marvelous dinner. The waiters and waitresses were very attentive and friendly. We had a great time!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The waiters are really friendly and very attentive.  They will bring you whatever level of done-ness you want for your meats.
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday desert was Carmel cheesecake. It&#39;s to die for!

EVvSCavCGdmhp5tyIrEvRw.text: Took a group for dinner. The restaurant is clean and set up well for privacy at the tables. The service was good. Our friends had never been there so I expected the server to go thru how it all worked but he didn't do that so we needed to. The market bar was good. The meat came out promptly and we didn't have any trouble getting what we wanted. I would say that sides that came to the table were a little cool and seemed like that had been sitting out but the sides are not that important at this restaurant. All in all a good experience.

VprVkh6V0jpzV3Sx2a1_Iw.text: We had our small company Christmas dinner here tonight and it was delicious!! I like how the servers are so helpful with direction and the salad bar if available right away. The quality of the meat was excellent. The bar had a great selection of wine and spirits , as well as an nice intimate atmosphere. Bring your appetite and pace your self!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We had a blast!!

mZMZrSlabCjNVxhZXs07VA.text: Meat was amazing! Service was Great! Make sure to always get their "Picanha" which is their house specialty..it is to die for! Make sure to get it Medium Rare!

Pe-Ou6dKpWKAtuYJh61gvg.text: I visited Fogo de Chao this week for lunch and it was great.   Salad Bar: You can easily fill up on the salad bar. Great selection and everything looked fresh.  Meats: The usual meats offered at other Brazilian steakhouses and everything I had was delicious. I often had to turn my card over so I could work on finishing what was starting to pile up.   Service: Service was great, plenty of attention with drink refills, offering meats, etc. There was a pretty decent lunch crowd but each time I turned my card over instantly someone was by my table ready to offer more meat.

wXWd2EiE2E0awjHcLEg0bQ.text: We went for lunch our first time and we had a great experience. We returned for Thanksgiving dinner and we had yet, another great experience.  Great salad bar, great meats, delicious bread, OUTSTANDING service. The sides we brought to us promptly and as we would run out of anything it was soon replaced without asking.   They are open for lunch everyday and my sweetheart and I visit every 2 weeks. Our favorite place to eat.

HjhRRQPBBtsf5WV_aHR4zA.text: This is probably the closest thing a real Brazilian churrascaria. Growing up in Brazil we used to go to this type of restaurant on a regular basis. The Salad bar is amazing and has enough selection for all types of eaters, even vegetarians. The meat selection is amazing, always cooked to perfection, right amount of seasoning and they will bring you whatever you want and at the temperature that you like. I highly recommend trying. Traditional Caipirinha! They are so good and good for you too!

ksqipShzd0marWgJx58Mzw.text: I've been coming to Fogo in Vegas since it opened, anytime I'm in town on business.  Ricardo and the staff there do a wonderful job on everything, from restaurant cleanliness, to service, to food.  And what's not to like?    It's a meat lovers paradise, with cut off meat being continually delivered to your table.  And for the vegetarians, which, I didn't realize I was taking a few off you on occasion.  They have a salad bar to die for!  The smoked salmon is out of this world!  Every client I've brought to Fogo has been turned into it ever since!  Not cheap, but the experience is worth every penny.

hN887CK9-XLjICJ-ogjoog.text: We visited here for lunch.  I'm a meat guy and not really intersted in anyones salad offerings.  I have visited every Brazilian steakhouse in town, besides samba and yolies.  The meat here is the best and I feel the service is the best as well.  The people seem to like their job and seem very genuine.  They were very attentive and always cooked the meat to my liking.  If it wasn't done well enough they brought us more.  I like medium well.  If you like salad I can't help you.  If you like meat and yuca cheese bread this is the place to visit.  Favorites sirloin lamb and cheese breads.

7tv4SE_ABizHmnOewboevg.text: My all time new favorite place to eat in Vegas!  Although it's expensive, it was worth every penny. Go hungry!! The Sangria was also great.

EVxex8NYXqW4yvurh22XqQ.text: Great service! Amazing flavors! Scalloped potatoes and flank steak are the winners for me! Oh... Wait! Allow me to mention the smoked salmon on the salad bar! Lunch price is a great deal! My mom will only eat well done meat, they totally accommodated her request. One of my favorites places! Will definitely be back!

3ZRkbTl9eEgq6sctBN1uhA.text: Las Vegas' Fogo de Chao is indeed as good as it gets. While living in Brazil, I ate at a lot of Brazilian Steakhouses. I definitely know what a True authentic brazilian steak should taste like. Fogo de Chao hits the nail right on the head! Every bite of their vast variety of all-you-can-eat meat was heavenly and took me right back to my days in Brazil. If you aren't satisfied with your meal here, you have no appreciation for a True Brazilian steak.  They have a wide variety of steaks, ranging from their famous picanha to chicken wrapped in bacon and everything in between. The one thing I was looking for that they didn't have was coracao de galinha, but they can't have EVERYTHING. They also have a salad bar, where you can get your veggies, or try some authentic beans and rice topped with farinha - because that is the Brazilian way! In my opinion, however, skip the salad and head straight for the meat. You didn't pay $50 for lettuce!  For drinks, my wife and I ordered some Brazilian lemonade, and let me tell you, if you have never had Brazilian lemonade, skip the wine and give it a try! It's the best lemonade you'll ever have.  After my wife and I gorged ourselves on succulent steak, we ordered dessert. I was delighted with a papaya & vanilla ice cream whip served in a large martini glass. After eating all that steak I was stuffed, but when I took a bite of the whip I all of a sudden found a little extra room and finished the whole glass. My wife ordered the flan and loved it, but couldn't finish it. Flan is (and should be) very thick and heavy.   Overall, Fogo de Chao is the closest you will get to Brazil without actually traveling there. If I could give it a 6th star, I would.

gSXl5dTDsfTlZMqcGm1X6w.text: This place is exactly the polar opposite of an Outback Steakhouse. Fogo had:  Excellent service, ambiance and food. Quality meats cooked to the right temperature,  fresh sides and an added treat of prosciutto made me a regular.  If your looking for a great meal in Las Vegas Fogo is a must.

dq3U6difoCeuitajMao7Zg.text: This place has some amazing Brazilian BBQ! The servers are constantly running to each table offering up a cut of their Brazilian BBQ that is fresh off the grill. The salad bar had a large variety of food as well. All the servers were very nice and friendly.

8TH6hYQ8eO6J_5Ybd-SLWg.text: Best service i feel like a king best place and my fav place to eat in LOVE.........??

9K_E24p5d032vmUrfoFe5w.text: Great meat done the way you like it.  The servers were falling over themselves  to make sure there was plenty of meat on the plate.  The salad bar surpasses your expectations.  Great food great value

Vpcaif6rRsvwG0G1_YjS4w.text: This restaurant is if the strip. Location is fine. Walk-in greeters are really friendly. Our reservation was not for another 30 minutes but they say us right away. The waiter was super attentive and helpful. The salad bar was amazing. Everything was so fresh. My favorite was the shrimp and mango salad. Perfect sweetness. Now to the good stuff. Every single cut from the pork to the filet minon were juicy and perfectly cooked. As long add you have your green yes please the protein will keep coming! It was a really nice experience just pricey. Would go back again on another special occasion.

kaagoO8dlUnmmhx4BSAsfw.text: I usually go to Texas de Brazil, but I wanted to try something new for a change. I heard great things about Fogo de Chao, so I was very excited to try it. I am only giving three stars because the market table was not even half as good as what I am used to at Texas de Brazil. The rice at Fogo literally taste like Uncle Ben's instant. No potatoes Au gratin, no lobster bisque, no marinated mushrooms. What the hell? Also, the ambiance was so boring I felt like I was sitting in Olive Garden. On a positive note, the staff was friendly and the meat was cooked nicely. I just felt like it lacked the fun, upbeat churrascaria experience with a disappointing salad bar.

GTeJhDy3LYBcGDxA5llLQg.text: went for a birthday dinner. It was a Sunday and not very packed. Service was excellent. The food was very good, I wasn't a fan of a couple of cuts of meat, but everyone has different taste. The tres leches cake was amazing. My husband is a huge fan, so I am sure we will be visiting again next time we are in town.

_Mh3CmNRMN33YexBsVx76Q.text: In love with this restaurant. Great place, very spacious, very clean and well organized. The staffs were nice and attentive.  Foods were amazing. I super love the Pao de Queijo, I could eat it everyday! Buffalo mozzarella is another treat i love. They have an extensive salad bar. They have soup and rice. Please add lobster bisque. Out of all the meat they serve, sausage is my favorite(I know Im a weirdo but hey!). Cant get enough of it. Picanha and filet mignon comes second. I dont really ask for the chicken. I should try though. Not a fan of lamb.  Ive tried the papaya cream and its oh so yummy goodness. Creme brulee is classic. For the drinks I had the traditional caipirinha and bellini caipirinha. Send more please. I spent New year's eve dinner here with families, my birthday, my husband and I's (non wedding) anniversary here. Next stop is wedding anniversary and husband's birthday. Will I ever come back? Definitely!

Ol0wxGPuGDakPZhCl3EOvQ.text: My favorite Brazilian steakhouse. Their meat does not even compare to any other of the other Brazilian steakhouses I've been to. Great selection at the salad bar and good fried plantains.

znICVMMgkIkRBq98KcsiOA.text: Filet mignon was the best followed by picanha, chicken etc. cheese bread is very good. Way too much food.  Chocolate kava cake and flan were pretty good. Not great. Kids 11 and 14 yr old girls were charged same price as adults. Really???

CPubObVmMZb9LD8_JAMe-A.text: I had no clue what to expect when eating at a Brazilian steakhouse. It was delicious!!! The waiters were VERY attentive! Not use to that... Wasn't a bad thing. They never let your drinks go low, anytime you turned your card over for more meat, 5 or so people came right away! Their bread and fried bananas were to die for!!! Worth the $50 for dinner.  Definitely going back!

ao6lQ9WsooGerI5Xg0FtQg.text: Love it! Not a place to go to loose weight, abou to go all out. Will come back here next time we are in LV.

T7GhaivIZMrQdGch3o2GBw.text: If you are a steak/wine lover, this place is like heaven. I have been to 4 location in different cities but this place never disappoints.  Service is as good as it can be, great selection of wine. Garlic Beef and cheese bread is to die for. One time we had a small issue (server forgot to bring wine) and the manager comped the whole bill for the two of us. I am a die hard fan for life.

TEFLWc0lKUB2gOC3RSBP0A.text: Ok. We went to fogo de chao cause it was something different and had amazing reviews. Sometimes yelp is wrong. The meats are hit or miss. One stick of filet is moist another is dry. The sides were very dull and uninspired. I can't really eat $51.50 worth of dinner anymore but the service and ambiance were lovely.

6GVHT1aYplYL04uTHWphDQ.text: Wonderful everything: outstanding salads, lovely meats (okay, some were more gristly than others), good service. Advice is to arrive early b/c it will fill up, and in time for half price drinks at the bar.

OHICZwqvUV_Rw4YJmU2L0w.text: Really, really good food as with all of these chains, but this place also has very good customer service and keep in touch with you throughout your meal to ensure you are happy each step of the way.

kKujroe2dCtiu8SEX5_QLg.text: today was my very first time to this restaurant. i just began a company and steven made stylesmakefights.com's night. he is the best waiter and worth a big hug from whomever reads this.  management he is why smf will come forever.

0odfBnVdXi4U5a3DfNhngA.text: $28 for lunch, superb food. Top Sirloin and Picania are my favorites. Come hungry, pace yourself, skip the meal prior to ensure you can engorge.  Nice staff, good salads. Convenient to strip

dYTLqWE2C059a4oq2xdBoA.text: This place has great, friendly service.  And yes, the free after-dinner (or before) chocolates at the hostess stand are delicious.   The Gauchos do not use Brazilian Portuguese terms for the meats... this was kind of disappointing since I was expecting that part of the fun learning experience.  Even if they have to explain what they said, that's part of the fun.  To skip this aspect seems... lazy.    Anyway, the Picanha is called "house special."  The bacon-wrapped filet mignon is CLEARLY the best choice; DO NOT waste time or stomach space on chicken. The sausage was ok, definitely not the tastiest part of the meal, nor the best I've ever had.  It wasn't even second or third best.  I'm not a fan of lamb, so I skipped that choice. The porterhouse was pretty good, but I suggest you ask for medium rare or medium since the well done cut is kind of a waste (and it wasn't very good).    Why waste room on the salad bar?  However, if you do, you'll find it has great options: asparagus, sun dried tomato, green olives, chilled grilled zucchini, spinach, lettuce, greens, tabouleh, etc.  They offer a free cheese bread; IT'S A TRAP!  Yes, it's REALLY good.  But that's how they sucker you into eating that crap instead of the EXPENSIVE MEATS!  The lemonade is more like limeade; it's very tangy, and I needed to add sugar.  The creme brulee was very good, large even for two people.  It's a nice way to top off your meal if you still have stomach space and failed to eat enough meat.   Do yourself a favor and be sure to make a reservation.  Immediately after I was seated, I saw a tour bus full of Japanese tourists come in with their group and I was really thankful I had made a reservation.

IsQLfOG8lM1BqujWny5kvQ.text: Wow great food and atmosphere.  All you can eat, and then some. If you are a carnivore this is the place for you. I highly recommend,  you won't be disappointed.

33mGg5VjXk9iN_da1xZnTw.text: i dont like the manager,and waiter staff, no courtesy at all, certainly ruined my day,,they didnt care about customer service,yells at me to read the fine print! then overcharges me with the food without explaining the costs, will never come back to this place, i dont recommend this place, if you do, your in for a suprise, goodluck people

HQhI2x_WAZ4NbYUi_7mDNQ.text: We had dinner here one time so far. Have to say it will not be the last! The food was awesome, service was awesome! We even had a peak into the kitchen to see how the meat is cooked!! Great place for AUCE Brazilian food!  So many meats to pick from and so good! The salad bar had so many items to pick from, You will not leave here hungry that's for sure!  So worth checking out!!

sobPe0NUUHgwM-CKzZWdAQ.text: After three days of lolling around being indolent I decided it was high time to get down to business and eat as many animals as humanly possible. Fogo recognized this basic gluttonous urge and, luckily, provided a veritable farm for me to eat.   Right off the bat I decided to prime my tummy with a caipirinha, which was strong and delicious and the perfect prelude to the meat storm about to go down. I mostly passed on the salad bar - I did have some marinated veggies and a little tabbouleh, so I could feel like I was at least getting a tiny bit of plant matter in - but the cheeses and cold cuts and salads all looked pretty yummy. When the pao de queijo came I hoovered those suckers like Pac-Man hoovers dots. And then I leveled up to the meats. Ohhhhh, the meats. All kinds of beef, pork, lamb, chicken - the best were the picanha (house cut) and the lombo (parmesan encrusted pork loin) but all were delicious. And kept coming. And coming. And coming. And coming. Until my belly was looking at least eight months pregnant and panting, exhausted, I could eat no more.   Is it gross to eat that much meat? I mean, objectively, yes. For sure. It's a wild excess and I probably shouldn't feel good about it. But the friendly gaucho servers, bus boys, hostess just made it a wonderful dinner that I felt great about. Except for the teensiest bit of trepidation while pondering how such profligacy would play out in my digestive system. Worth it!

VxVumswKj_K0r0YZ010oFA.text: Ahh Yelp Spring Break, so many deals to choose from, not enough money to spend LOL!  Made reservations here because of Vanessa H's review.  Our experience was remarkable. I've never been to a Brazilian steakhouse before so I had little expectations. The only thing I did not like about this place was house easily they refill your food. The servers took a half-filled plate of mashed potatoes and replaced it with a new one. Seemed pretty wasteful. Same thing goes for the salad bar where they rotate or rather refresh the items every few minutes.  Yelp has made me very open-minded when it comes to food so I was able to try pretty much any of the meats they brought to the table. The house special was what hit the spot for me, as well as the lamb.   Even without the Yelp deal, I would willingly pay for this place. Which almost happened by the way, as the manager looked at my Yelp Spring Break guide with much confusion. He borrowed it for a bit and I guess educated his staff about it and everything went without a hitch!

Fa_jFhpmobMTK9T1NR8QYg.text: Hooray for a churrascaria!  We popped into Fogo de Chao on our last day in Vegas -- making use of a killer Yelp deal we got through it's spring break promotions. $37 gave us the pleasure of having friendly men with meat on spits come by to our table and offer us delicious offering after delicious offering until our bellies split.  The house special and the parmesan pork were my favorite carnivorous offerings -- although everything I sampled was delicious and perfectly cooked. I was extremely happy with 2 different lamb offerings, and pleased that I could request more of particular cuts that I liked.  I also was severely tempted to dump a basket of the pao de queijo (cheesy popover things) into my purse. Warm, semi squishy inside -- that cheesy bread was extremely good and very very hard to put down. The polenta cakes, garlic mashed potatoes and the carmelized fried bananas were also super amazing. A meal could be made out of just the side dishes offered here! I did make a quick 'round the buffet -- nabbing only a couple nibbles of cheese and broccoli. Cuz I mean, come on! You ~are~ here for the meat.    Service was impeccable. We were promptly seated, water was immediately on the table, plates cleared when they looked a little worse for the wear, and every person --from the waiter, the cocktail lady, and the guachos were incredibly professional and friendly.    Fogo was the best and all around wonderful last meal for my Vegas vacation.

JOYbERUynYsxRXlOent-wg.text: I live in San Diego and went to that location a few months ago, then moved here for the summer and realized there's a Fogo de Chao here also.  Went on the 4th of July and it was just as great as I remembered.  The service is great, waiters are very professional, and the food is delicious.  I have tried a few other brazilian bbq places, but Fogo de Chao is definitely my favorite so far.  I'm really glad they opened the San Diego one as well so I can keep going there when I move back.

adxaGFBV8YdYEMRgb5plqg.text: Been to so many Brazilian Steakhouses and this one has to be one of the top on my list..  Came here for lunch with a group of friends.  I made reservations in advance (open table!).  Moment we sat down, server introduced and took our drink order.  We were asked if we had been here before.  We were shown the salad bar.  I love how each person would have their own little "More/Stop" meat service tab.  Most places would have just one tab for the table.  Very efficient.  Lets start with the salad bar, big selection.  Things that stood out to me was the cheese and salami treats.  I get suckered into that.    We came as soon as they opened so I believe that most of the meat was still cooking, but once we came back from the salad bar.. It's on!  Endless meat and quite a selection.  I found their signature (picanha) was amazing; moist and tender packed with flavor.  Most Brazilian Steakhouses carry the same common meats, but Fogo had a parmesan pork loin (lamb).  I was in for a treat!  Sadly, I could not eat a lot.  The table also had additional side item such as caramelized banana and polenta.  It was across the table from me and I could not reach it.  We each got a dessert.  I went for the turtle cheesecake.  Suck when it comes to cheesecake.  I felt that I picked a solid choice.  When it arrived, lots of caramel.  Smothered it in, and as a nice display, a little orchid next to it.  Amazing! after my first bite.  The service of course was superb!  Most of the meat are well marinated and packed full of flavor of course made me thirsty.  I went through plenty of water, luckily our server was on top and made it endless for me.  I am amazed that they were able to provide such service even when the place was getting a lunch rush.  Lots of places fall short when it comes to the front house, but they got it down here!  The atmosphere here is a little dim, more of the "special occasion" type.  Not too loud.  Square and round tables available.  Nice little display on the way in (Rack of meat on a fire pit).    Def will come back.  I just have to build up a better appitite for next time.

rlT9fp6aKIdSyc3UwhIZyQ.text: Being a 20yr Executive Chef,  let's start off by saying every dish is meticulously prepared using the finest ingredients. I was especially impressed with the cold bar.   I've tried many of the Brazil grills here and by far,  this Restaurant surprisingly out shines them all by a mile.   My tip would be, pace yourself at the cold bar no matter how great it is. I always tend to fill up before I flip my card to start my meats rolling in. They will come quickly so to keep the meats hot, flip the card over to stop and eat.

T-VEP2xpznSGwVixxZkzPQ.text: Every time we come here for celebration or birthday or graduation, their food is excellent. They never fail to accommodate your needs. Their steaks is perfectly specially their leg of lamb. The dessert is also good. I would recommend this place.

S4qTVi_fcCDtrOFN27j02A.text: Pricey but worth every last dollar. Absolutely delicious. If you ever want to splurge a little on a night out, this is definitely a recommendation.  Carnivore's paradise, and unlike other AYCE experiences, the food is all top quality. Obviously, you will never leave hungry.

FtZ77pwTX0Ps8s0zznoI2A.text: We had our wedding reception there and was perfect, the food  and the service are excellent . They even received during the day our wedding cake.

RpxD4KrklbRvc_rT23dj6Q.text: Saw this place while at the Habit Grill yesterday and made immediate plans to check it out! We decided to go today on the lunch special ($34.95 for the full churrasco experience) . Lunch hours are held from 11:30 am- 2:00 pm.  Made reservations online and was at the door when they opened!  Salad Bar (5/5) So many fresh and tasty options! Their caesar salad was fantastic! Also enjoyed the fresh pineapple, salami, peppered and smoked bacon, and asparagus! Countless options available at their salad bar!  Sides (5/5) Cheese bread balls are like crack! Seriously. Very habit forming and addicting! Mashed potatoes were savory as well!   Also enjoyed the fried bananas to cleanse the palette!  Meats (5/5) Yummy! Yummy! Yummy! Enjoyed so many savory, tasty meats! Lamb chops, fillet mignon, flank steak, bacon wrapped chicken, sausage, and bacon wrapped filet mignon just to name a few! The filet mignon was my favorite, with the flank steak a close second!  What stood out to us was how flavorful the meats tasted. At the only other Brazilian Steakhouse I have been to recently (*Texas*cough*Texas*), their meats tasted too salty. So much so that it really took away from the whole thing. Not here at Fogo! Meats were delicious and full of flavor! Cooked and seasoned superbly!  Service (5/5) Seriously, some incredibly attentive and friendly service! Wildly impressed by how we were treated by everyone, from the first person we saw and spoke to all the way to the very last person we saw and spoke to! All were friendly, personable, and accommodating!  This was such a fantastic experience that we have plans to bring some of our friends here to share this great place with!  Can't wait to come back!  5 stars.  Woohoo! As good as it gets!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7pcJqr2hk6hagHoKz9rAbg.text: BEST SERVICE EVER!!  Our server was Luis and the manager in our section was Kappa. I'm a server myself and I've been to several "nicer" restaurants but this is by far, my favorite place!! Well first, the food was really good and personally, I'd recommend the garlic steak the most and I loved the bacon from the salad bar thing.   Okay, in terms of service, every single person who came to our table was so friendly and completely catered to us. For example, a guy came up offering steak but didn't have medium well and later came back and REMEMBERED us and gave us the medium well steak we originally wanted. Our server also remembered everything we asked for and ensured that we got the steaks we asked for. The manager Kappa gave us brand new plates (since our current ones were dirty) and even though we said "oh it's okay we're almost done anyway" he said "no you are my guests and deserve the best" then gave us brand new plates and a whole refill on our plates.  Our server, Luis was extremely friendly and the hostess was also very prompt and helpful. Overall, everyone was very attentive and GREAT! Thanks for a great dinner and first dinner in Vegas

lSogNN0DRtx-JoSyMySbJw.text: This is a great location. Service and food is the best FDC. They were very prompt with getting you the meats/cuts you wanted. Made sure you were not with an empty plate.   Plenty of parking too. No need to valet.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad bar

CaWIttcrEtTWX7XSaRlhXQ.text: Hold on to your hats folks, this is gonna be a good one. Before I begin I have to say our server and all of the food servers were very nice!   So my boyfriend and I LOVE Texas de Brazil, but I had been to a Fogo de Chao in LA, and the ambiance was just more formal. Considering we were celebrating our 3 year anniversary, we decided to give it a try. We dress up super nice, and must say we were probably the nicest dressed of everyone there.  What a horrible mistake to come here... First when we get there my boyfriend goes straight for the salad bar as always, he comes back with minimal food on his plate which is unusual because let's be honest he's 6'3 and a big guy. Well, he tells me there were flies over some of the food... gross. So he ended up not even eating the salad bar, and I didn't either nor even make a plate. We had to ask for sides, they were never brought and then some were brought out cold.  Later the meat shows up at our table 1 by 1 and at first it's going great everything is tasting good. But then we get some type of garlic steak? Well I bit into it and what do you know a nice piece of fat and straight garlic seasoning in my mouth. Like I am talking course garlic powdery rub. It was horrible, and then ruined my palette because all I could taste was garlic for the next few hours. We received cold mashed potatoes. Finally I ask to speak to a manager. I work in a restaurant so I get that things go wrong, but it's our anniversary and just one thing after the other. The manager apologizes and we think everything is good. He says he will take care of the steak but will still charge up for the salad bar.... (which we didn't eat mind you). And to be honest it wasn't even about the money, we just wanted to leave.  ANYWAYS. He tries to bring out new meat and sides. Potatoes come out watery and cold this time again, and he brings the Parmesan pork. My boyfriend takes it, and he asks me 3 times even though I say no if I want some as well (I don't eat very much pork). He keeps insisting by saying that he made it special for us and we should eat it. I finally say yes because he won't stop bugging me about it. I immediately decide that we aren't eating it because it was so sketchy, he made it seem like he may have done something to the food. We then had multiple people ask if we wanted dessert and politely declined saying we were full (we weren't just wanted to escape this place), and they brought out a cheesecake anyways and are you ready for it... the manager again says "I made this special just for you. And the best part? The cake said happy birthday on it!! We don't eat the cake (even though they were watching to see if we did, which made me even more scared that it had been tainted). We receive the check and are still charged full price. He goes to fix it and then says "this is the best I can do, take it as a half off coupon"... and we left. Paid 62$, plus tip for our server (who was still amazing and felt horrible so of course we still tipped him well) for an ATROCIOUS NIGHT. I will never ever be back here again.  The manager had this creepy, devilish look to him like he was trying to get pay back for us complaining. Super uncomfortable. If I could give 0 stars I would.

RBXqDoYOXNwi4lVEZ99eSg.text: Thanksgiving dinner was ruined by choosing to celebrate our family time here. We made 7pm reservations a week prior to Thanksgiving and confirmed them the next day. Only to be told the day of TG that our reservations were not in the system and that there were no room to make new reservations for the night. Angry and upset I wanted to still try making a reservation online, and it allowed me to do so...even though I was just told there were no more tables available for the night.   We still decided to go and service was horrible. We had to wait LONG periods of time for servers to come around with the different meats...our waiter only came to the table twice, and the food was not up to the par of any other Fogo De Chao. We were greatly disappointed. After all, maybe them cancelling our reservation was a sign!

Un2A_uH_gQmqfuRFnoqPnQ.text: Love Fogo!! We have been to other locations but the Vegas location is the best!! Very attentive service. Once you flip tor card for meat, it's a steady stream of delicious cuts. The garlic steak and lamb were quickly my favorites, but all the selections were good. The salad bar was amazing as well. It was filled with fresh fruit, salads, and everything to complement the evening meal.  You will not go away hungry!! They just keep coming with meat selections until you flip your card back over to say stop. Do yourself a flavor and check out Fogo Vegas, you'll love it!!

JsYcAfBRbnM12804HObQKA.text: I don't really leave reviews but I had to for this.  They never asked if we wanted sides   But the waiter told the manager he did. Twice.  All we wanted was a free Diet Coke and the manager literally said I won't do that.  On top of all that you could tell the meat was frozen.  No real taste. No salt and pepper.  It smelled and seemed old. The filet mignon Was driving didn't have that signature Brazilian smell or taste.  This was truly a bad dining experience. On top of that they bring you in for a 30 dollar restaurant week special. The ad just says all you can eat.  But when you get there they make you upgrade to get the better cuts of meat.  This place is just not good.

BAa8tJP_YFQSIxJ8iWXVqA.text: Delicious!! The garlic steak was perfection and the filet was super tender. Service was great, tried a recommended drink but we didn't like it and they took it off the tab. The flan was delicious as well. Would definitely recommend.

ztN91pD2Cn4Ajn5B6UXENA.text: Omg, the best place to put meat in your mouth! Almost every cut of meat that you can think of they have.  The meat feels as thought its melting in your mouth. The fillets, the chicken breast wraped in bacon, sirloin,  omg delicious!!!!! The beans and rice at salad bar, amazing. The salad bar and fruit are great as well. Try the cucumber mint drink. Creme brulee and chocolate molton cake to die for. I can't rave enough about this place. Also the entire staff was super friendly from the hostess,  bartender and waiters who were super funny as well.  Wonderful staff. We were there about almost 3 hours talking and eating and talking and they were always friendly.  I recommend this place for any family event and business.

VQ89AnuDf8FlMBeFj2EqPQ.text: We have been coming here for years. The experience is always decent but has been fantastic past few times. The beef ribs and lamb chops are our favorite things.

E0YwGokdTkAtKsKRWHRnhw.text: If you've eaten at one Brazilian meat House you've eaten at all of them. Large salad bar to fill you up, flame roasted meat, not real steak if you ask me but whatever.

Jz4w-5jSjftWZy2Tq3Bptw.text: I don't think the price worth what you get.  After a few times they stop coming with the goodies parts, like filet, picannia, and top sirloin.  The mashed potatoes wes extremely testy.   For dessert we ordered Flan, it Wes bad so we returned it.   Bootom line, I don't think thet I will return to this restaurant.

ba_8GpF4CSBOyWZ7TPfspw.text: Better come hungry... Fogo de Chao Brazilian Steakhouse will give you meat and more meat! It is a one of a kind experience that will leave you wanting more, but you'll be beyond stuff.

jC_PHNgYVOvxBirLbn5nPw.text: I had a bad time at your Las Vegas location a few days ago. I have been to two locations of Fogo de Chao. I visited the one in Troy, Michigan. It was a pleasant experience so I decided to go to the one in Las Vegas with my boyfriend and parents during our trip there. It was my birthday dinner, May 29th. I was looking forward to a wonderful dinner like the one I have in Troy. But this time, the servers' attitude was terrible. There were only three or four kinds of meat being served during the dinner. I can still remember they were a sirloin, a chicken, and a sausage.  We asked for filet mignon for three times but it was never there. When we asked for the lamb chop a server was so impatient that he even rolled his eyes and told us it was not ready yet. Our plates were full of bones but there was nobody changing it for us. We asked a server to change the plate and he said he was going to grab our server for us but he did not come back. The first time we got our plates changed was when we finished our dinner. One last thing, the people in the store were so eager to make us leave that they took all the plates away when I still wanted some fruits from the salad bar. I even did not get my free birthday dessert. Nobody told us that I should have a free birthday dessert. I asked if I would get promotions for my birthday and the server simply told me no. IT WAS THE WORSE BIRTHDAY DINNER I HAVE EVER HAD.

qFTb4pw9uWxOD-lHDFz8Ig.text: Skip the meat! We stopped in for my friend's 50th birthday and although she had a good time, I was underwhelmed for the hefty price of $174 for three people with no drinks except a few cokes. My advice to you if you read this review: take the other negative reviews to heart.  While the host and our server were nice, the meat servers were rude. The market bar/salad bar was quite good, but I was really disappointed by the meat - the main seasoning was salt and there was way too much of it.  To sum: bottom sirloin - or was it top? Anyway, this was the best meat by far...tender and flavorful  ribeye - too salty with a hefty salt crust, otherwise fine  lamb chops - pretty good, but I didn't like the spice mix used  filet wrapped in bacon - salt from the bacon overwhelmed any flavor  pork rib - horrible, the worst - gamey and possibly undercooked - I left it  I was bummed and a little hungry.  I was also miffed that they didn't offer us a complimentary dessert for the birthday girl -- lame!  Also, shortly after our meal, all of three of us had stomach issues and spent some time in the bathroom - my guess - the lamb? or the pork? Bleh. I would come back for the salad bar and skip the meat.

KWsm2K_JbpLvnBDOhCnwhw.text: Visited place on 8/25/18 wife wanted to go thinking it will be like Agora in south California nothing like it overpriced,  and tried chicken flavorless, tried the filet mignon not impressed too much salt, then the veal and finally the meat wrapped in bacon way too salty and greasy.  Best thing salad bar and the bread.  Also someone shows up barely speaking English and leaves a bowl of shrimp on my table I taught it was included,   paid bill with my high limit American Express and I was told if I had another card that it did not go thru told her impossible but glad I was with my wife very surprised gave them my discover and I used my card 10 minutes later and perfect probably they did not like American Express or wanted cash.  Never again

X-wH-oDJb4z6pBCURVqlgg.text: The meat is fantastically cooked over charcoal!! So DELICIOUS!! Our waiter, Cameron, was welcoming and helpful :) ! The manager, Tracy, and all the servers were FUN, they made our lunch delightfully enjoyable!!

VmbagytYrAdjayNzguoVMA.text: Oh My Goodness!!! Man can't say enough good things about this place. I took my fiance so that could have a romantic dinner for two and was blown away by the warmth and courtesy of this place. Our experience started at the door when the two ladies welcome us and showed us to our seats in a timely manner. We were then introduced to our server Jose who immediately came over and ran down the menu items and house specials.  At this point we turned our service cards from red to green and began to take in some of the best meats I have ever had. My favorites were the bacon wrapped filet mignon and the flank steak. I recommend the both I also recommend the house brown sugar/black pepper bacon and beans and rice from the salad bar which were also big hits! We finished our night with the chocolate mouse cake and could not have been happier with the taste. It was delicious and not overwhelmingly sweet which we preferred. Upon leaving we met another Jose or "Ariel"as he is called who checked in with us and ensured that our night went smooth and offered to take care of anything else we needed. A great night! We will definitely be back! Thanks fellas! For making our night a special one!

Xjs8899MxwRirl4w6zjJLQ.text: I have multiple sclerosis and every couple of months Fogo De Chao hosts a free luncheon for our MS LifeLines support group meetings where we are able to listen to different Dr's & Neurologists speak about MS News & let me say if not for these events I would never be able to experience this delicious place. Not only is the food absolutely five star the servers are five star plus! Beyond kind polite and will always be accommodating in every way! I look forward to our next Fogo MS event!

xWhasfqyK2J8lM7zXx-ebw.text: wonderful.   the food is great, the service and people that work here are awesome.   great value if you don't want to go to an ala carte steakhouse on the strip that will cost 2x the amount.   atmosphere is also a plus.

Q-sdjWB-zNSPcT0rxG1Ehw.text: For the price of dinner here I wasn't too satisfied. The options on the meats were not a lot. I felt like they walked around with the Same steak options. Needs more meat options (insert clap emoji). The food bar Options were good tho lost to choose from. The drinks were also great. Woulda have gave more stars if there were more meat options.

rkJjqexpItGAfwduZrmM7A.text: This is an overdue update for a carnivore's dream.  Fogo de Chao - the last word of which is actually pronounced much like "shone" - is a Brazilian steakhouse. It can also described as a churrascaria, or a place that grills the meats, or rodizio, a service style where the meats are brought tableside for customers to select from. If that concept is new to you, just think about how amazing that is: they cook it for you, they bring it to your table, and they cut it for you.  If you're feeling meat-averse that day for some reason, you can stick to the Market Table option. There are lots of sliced meats, salads, veggies, fruits, and even soup for all-you-can-eat consumption there. You can easily make a delicious, filling meal out of those if you have to for some reason. Alternatively, if you're doing the Full Churrasco Experience, you can come here and carefully pick out items to compliment your meats as I do. I'll typically get roasted bell peppers, marinated onions, mushrooms, cheeses, the amazing sweet and peppery bacon, and maybe a bit of soup.  (At meal's end, I'll also grab some sliced oranges or other fruit rather than go for an a la carte dessert. The way I approach this, if I didn't get nauseatingly full on meat, I would feel as if I'd made a grievous mistake.)  As I implied earlier, the Full Churrasco Experience is where it's at. Just flip your tableside marker green-side up and they'll bring endless meats on giant skewers to your table. You can simply say yes, ask for larger portions, specify certain temperatures for red meats (although I'll stare at you oddly if you ask for anything over medium or even medium-rare), or even say no thanks / not right now. I've been declining chicken and pork options quite a bit - even the pork ribs - but they're available if I ever felt the need.  Why do I skip those white meats? Because the beef selection here is incredible. Sure, you can go to a decent steakhouse chain for a similar price, but why bother when you can get endless amounts of comparably delicious meats? The house special sirloin, aka picanha, is still my fave. The seasoning is intense and highlights and a tender, fatty cut. Garlic beef was actually my second favorite today despite the gray interior; it was still tender, and I loved the garlic marinade/butter. One more must-have is more of a "secret" and it's the beef rib. Try to request it if you can; it's brown through and through, but it's somehow still tender and juicy while providing a beefier flavor than anything else.  The ribeye, other sirloins, flank steak, and filet are also great, but I could go without them. The other beef options can suffice, and I also enjoy lamb. There was a delicious lamb steak today that was a lovely shade of pink in the middle. I recommend skipping the mint jelly if that ever enters your mind; it's way too sweet, toothpaste-like, and overpowering. Stick to the chimichurri sauce to kick up your meats a notch as your stomach fills, and also use complementary veggies.  My other all-you-can-eat trick is to wait until getting partially full to start on the sides, which are automatically brought to your table. The pao de queijo (cheese bread) is easily the best and maintains a soft, chewy texture in every bite, hot or lukewarm. The fried polenta is fine but could be a little more fluffy in the middle. I generally minimize my mashed potato consumption here; they're good, but not outstanding.  I've been slacking on this update, but after trying enough other beefy competitors including steakhouse chains and rival churrascarias, I can't help but find them lacking compared to Fogo de Chao. Sure, pricing has crept up a bit over the years (check their website for specifics), but you can subscribe to their email list for occasional discounts and stick to brunch - or even weekday lunch, if possible - for the same meats at a better price. And as delicious as their lemonade, caipirinhas, or other beverages may be, you probably can get away without them (or with them, if it's a special occasion).

k1UBNQQwG6-NB0KeUrJZIw.text: Food and service was good. HOWEVER, the reason why I'm giving 2 stars and not 5 is because of the shady advertisement tactic. Shows on their Instagram page that they were doing a "$39 dinner restaurant month" promotion, so that's the only reason why we were there in the first place. Only after we finished eating that they told us "oh you have to tell us ahead of time about the special." NO WHERE in the Instagram post did it say that we had to tell our server ahead of time and that certain cuts were excluded. Smh. Why not mention the special and give us options before we started eating? I didn't want to argue and hassle the server because she was actually nice, but that's just dirty.

ZFwMo6XJDUiTKTMRB6xdIQ.text: I've been to a few Brazilian steak houses and this one by far has been my favorite in my hometown. It's located a little ways from the strip. A few restaurants within range but great location, easy to find. A fairly small parking lot but not really an issue.  The ambiance is soft and romantic. A beautiful salad bar with extra finger foods. All of which taste delicious! It is all included ( buffet style) is what I would call it.   You have what looks like a small drink coaster with red and green. When you are ready for those mouth watering meats passing by you constantly you quickly flip that card to green and they start rolling in!!   You can get your meat rare to well done!! There is usually 7 or more kinds of meat going around all with bursting flavors. Most of which is steak but you get surprised with lamb chops and sausage etc!!   It didn't seem like we had a set server, we did have an awesome carver who made us laugh. He made our night even better his name was junior very outgoing! We spent about an hour and a half dining, we almost needed piggy back rides out of there!  It was a bit pricey, but if you can eat you can easily get your monies worth! We do this every 3-6 months.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red card means stop!!! Green card means keep it coming!!

O2cUIt6T2j6oKFRBqCm_lQ.text: What else can you say about an establishment that brings you meat until you tap out? What can you say about the variety and quality? You can say a lot-  the service is dynamite - the food quality is amazing - and the ambiance is wonderful. From the chicken to the beef to the lamb- a wonderful place to eat.

vU3wNpx3O8meJNJi2pKdhw.text: Amazing service and outstanding food for the carnivores in your family! Our family and company has attended dinner their several times and we've never been disappointed.

WuJp4hy3zLFx_0yDFhZqzg.text: Delicious food and excellent service! It's worth every penny. I did wish they had more hot foods to choose from in the buffet area. When we went it was just rice, seasonal soup, and beans. But they had a lot of other great things to choose from and the waiters were punctual and friendly! Would definitely come back.

xqGys65NsCoZ30Gfxx-UDQ.text: This is hands down the best Fogo!  I've been to both locations back home in LA. And the service here in Vegas doesn't even compare to the others.   Everyone is super friendly, the managers are constantly asking if there is any requests or if there's anything we need at all. The meat is amazing as well. The best cut we prefer is picanha. It's so tender and full of flavor. We also love the sausages.   Every time we come to Vegas, this is a have to eat

BfYOGH28rSjL9vqip_twEQ.text: Yet another reason why you don't trust yelp for reviews when the restaurant is close to the strip.  Attempting to give another bbbq establishment a try my gf and I decided to go here. Our usual place is Texas de Brazil but we thought it fair to branch out for once.  This was definitely a mistake on our part.   We we seated at 6:15 on a Friday night, just the two of us. Ordered drinks and went to the buffet area to grab some sides.  Came back to our table and started eating and proceeded to wait.. and wait.. 15 mins after we sat down the first gaucho came around.  Then 5 mins later the second. 20 mins after be seated we had only seen two of them. At $55 a person this is unacceptable. There's 15 different proteins on the menu.   Three times different servers came around asking if we needed anything and each time I said yes, where's the gauchos?  Only after the third server came around did we get what we had actually requested.  All in all it took over 30 minutes just to get what we were after, and we never even got to see all of their offerings because of the lack of attentiveness by the gauchos.   In all my bbbq experiences this was by far the worst one I've ever had. The salad bar area was comical compared to other establishments I've been to, even ones with a cheaper price of entry.  The only "highlight" really was the beans and rice, something I can whip up at home with my eyes closed.  The mashed potatoes were watery, the chimichurri sauce (that you have to request from the server) was extremely under seasoned (no salt).  We we're comped for some of our meal which was appreciated. Oscar was attentive to the situation but honestly the situation shouldn't of happened in the first place.  At the end of the day this is a second rate establishment charging first rate prices. Perhaps they should reconsider some of their methods.

ea__S33Q0Tq1nIDpFo5H_A.text: Came here on an anniversary weekend. The place is amazing. Most meats were cooked to perfection. The salad bar was so delicious with not just salads, but cured meats, cheese, soups, and fruit. And the meat, well it just keeps coming! The service is outstanding. You'll pay the price but it is well worth it especially if you're trying to impress. This is fine dining meets All you can Eat!

YnFDPm98vZGA6eM6KTVE5w.text: Wow... I can't believe what an experience my husband and I just had.  First off we were just at this restaurant for Father's Day with family and spent over $700. On Father's Day food was great and the service was even better.   So my husband and I decided come back for our anniversary.   When we made our reservation the hostess said that we would get a a complimentary dessert for our special day.   Today  1-Service~ We had to keep looking around for someone to refill our drinks.  *Then they filled my drink and walked away from my husbands empty glass.   2-The server that was handling our dessert and bill was so over the top loud that other tables were looking at us when she was talking.   Just this experience alone was extremely embarrassing.  When we brought up the complimentary dessert she said   ( oh no you do not get a Free Dessert)   then she brought us the bill and tried charging us $41.00 a person when we only had the salad bar.  Then having to discuss the issues she is still being so fricking loud.   So I just got up. I was done at this point.  Lost any appetite for dessert and this lady was ruining my anniversary lunch. I just wanted to leave.  While walking up I went up to talk with someone about what was taking place and was cut off mid sentence.   I am talking about how loud and embarrassing the server is being and the manager is talking about a bill mix up.   Things happen I can understand a bill mix up, but a loud disrespectful server in an expensive restaurant should NOT be tolerated!   Was here twice this month spent so much money and I will never give them one more dime!

2paL836FPKCrli9eU59ZRw.text: Visiting Las Vegas for my birthday. My wife I wanted to try this restaurant for our first time.  Making reservations and people were very nice.   When our waiter came to our table, we explained we were visiting for the first time. He explained the process.  He suggested the dry age tomahawk. We made the mistake of not asking additional questions such as reviewing the menu prior to ordering. This was our fault that we got mislead into.  My advice, read the MENU and KNOW/UNDERSTAND the prices. Just because the waiter is nice, DO NOT get misled or your meal will be $$$$.

WmPU3SIt0UCzTv9LeULqBw.text: We were visiting Las Vegas and had eaten at the downtown LA location a few times before and had such a great experience there but felt quite disappointed with this location.  We had reservations and upon arrival had to wait at least 15 minutes for the hostess to return to the reception area, with no apology only a smile.   It was a week night and there were many open tables yet we were seated next to the loudest group AND a screaming baby.  Fantastic.  The smoked salmon at Market Table looked tempting but there were brown spots on almost all of the pieces that were strategically hidden until you grabbed it and placed it on your plate.  Well played.  Some of the greens and roasted vegetables also looked foul and tasted old in spite of the uneven seasoning on some of the pieces.  The cheese rolls were big but also very cold and stale.  Not one time was the all famous Picanha served and we were only told it was coming soon.  The lamb chunks not chops were gamey and dry; and the sirloin was not medium rare as we asked but very raw and cold! So much for premium meat offerings!  I cannot believe we paid $250 for this! The server checked on us twice and never even returned.  Two other servers had to refill our drinks and give us the check!  This was more of a $25 dinner for 3!  We should have gone to Texas de Brazil instead but now know not to return to this location nor recommend it to friends and family. How unfortunate was this experience! =(

QkzV_svgNNcAFF9V2Y2ADg.text: I'd like to start off to say that the service was impeccable. Our water glasses were filled constantly. The servers were attentive and friendly.  All three stars go to the service! The food I wasn't impressed. All the meats were incredibly salty. The salad bar doesn't validate what they charge for it.  The tables / carpet / decor in general all looks a bit dated. It needs a little freshening up. The most flavorful meat I had was the garlic beef but I never saw it come back around again. The chicken and sausages came around a lot probably because they want people to get full off the cheaper meats. Another possibility is no one was taking the chicken and sausage so they kept circling all the tables with those meats. Anyways, for the price we paid, I'd rather go to an a la carte steakhouse.

E1jJyaeLVBH2btO1tvbyTQ.text: If I can give Fogo de Chao a ZERO or maybe in the negative I would. We had a party of 16 which I made a reservation for and we were extremely excited to try this place out for a birthday dinner. The moment they walked us to our table and start sitting us down, the server start blabbing quick words regarding about their menus and what not. We really appreciate that the server was trying to do his job. However, keep in mind that not even half of us are seated yet. In the mist of all of us trying to settle down and find our seat. He start forcing us to make a decision of what we want to eat. We had no time to look at the menu or even had the time to order drinks. We had few questions that we wanted to ask before ordering because we wanted to know the difference between their regular menu and their restaurant week menu. The server was very pushy and rude in trying to up sell their regular menu. At the end he pretty much made the choice for us and did not allow us to get the restaurant week menu. Finally, after I can no longer tolerate how the server keeps on rushing us to make decisions. I expressed to him that he needs to give people a minute and that he need to stop rushing people. The whole experience here seem like we were getting rushed throughout the entire dinner.   The food here is below average compared to Texas de Brazil. The salad bar was not fresh and there was not a lot of options. The meat was very tough, hard to chewy, very dry and salty. Definitely not worth the price. We end up paying 70 dollars per person. Also forgot to mention that the server gave us no choice of selecting water options and we end up having to pay 80 dollars for water. This is the worst restaurant experience ever. This is a chain restaurant, really don't understand how the quality control of food and service is this bad.   Definitely will not come back and would not recommend this place to anyone.

8U394rn4yJ2m46NGzwk6zA.text: Let me set the the tone for this review... This was the best Brazilian steakhouse I've ever been to. The atmosphere is very relaxed and the staff is the best I've ever experienced. The manager checked on all the tables to make sure everyone was satisfied and if you want anything all you have to do is ask and they will bring it to you. Within five minutes of sitting down I had many forms of dead animal on my plate. Beef, pork, chicken, and lamb of many cuts. All cuts were very flavorful and succulent. Although the chicken was a little dry but good flavor. The salad bar was also very good with a surprise addition. The salad bar has maple peppercorn bacon  This sweet salty slice of heaven was a great compliment to the seasoned meats. YOU HAVE TO TRY THE SALAD BAR BACON!!! The $60 per person price is worth it. They also have a 10% military discount. I will visit every time I come to Vegas.

Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BACON!!!! ...sausage, chicken and something else

udUalfO-6V_drh07OE9J0A.text: It is getting so that a trip to Vegas is not complete without a visit to Fogo!  This is a traditional Brazilian Steakhouse where different cuts of meat are brought to you and carved tableside. You can't go wrong with platters of meat!  The beef options are amazing as are the chicken options. The sausage tends to be a little salty and the pork cutlet types, too dry.  But you have to hit the salad bar and walk away with a plate of bacon. Sweet sweet bacon! I have dreams about their sweet bacon.

ICoGZPYA_ma_FQqWNhz3Rg.text: I hate to see places that used to be on my top list to go downhill, but this is how I feel about Fogo in Las Vegas. My party of 3 and I made reservations through Open Table for 8:00 pm. We arrived five minutes earlier and were told we would be seated shortly. So, we waited at the bar area and ordered a caipirinha.  At 8:30 pm the hostess took us to our table and apologized for them taking so long. When I arrived at the table the floor around it was disgusting. There were food leftovers all over the place. It was a mess! I didn't care because I was hungry. Our waiter was nice, he brought us waters, more caipirinhas and the sides for the steaks. I'm just disappointed to see a great restaurant like Fogo to look so disorganize and lowering the quality. The experience is just not the same anymore.  The Restaurant:  Last couple times I've been here I think the restaurant does not look clean. A lot of food leftovers over the floor. The restrooms are not well kept. They have sticky floors and toilet paper all over the place. The restaurant is big, it has some private rooms for special events and a bar area.   The Food: This is a Brazilian steak house, so they have the "gaucho guys" bringing steaks, chicken, lamb, and sausages.  The food continues to be good, but I feel it was better before. They are charcoaling too much to outside part of the steak and it tastes burned when you get an outside layer of meat. I don't know what's happening inside the kitchen that they can't keep up with the demand of "Pao de Queijo" (the most amazing cheese bread, typical from Brazil). Last couple times I have visited the restaurant they don't have enough bread! Two years ago, they would just bring you basket after basket.  In addition to the salad bar, rice, beans, soup. They have sides to accompany the steaks: "Caramelized bananas, mashed potatoes, and fried polenta" They are all delicious, my favorite is the bananas OMG!! YUMMM...    The Service:   I think the best service at the restaurant is given by the Gauchos, they all work so hard and make sure you get the steak of your preference cooked how you like it. The hostess and waiters are just OK. He didn't really check how we were doing with sides, we were not offered more caipirinhas or water.  The Fogo from the good old times always got us caipirinha, after caipirinha. They also used to get us clean dishes after so many courses but not anymore. When will that Fogo be back?

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gaucho guy with some steak
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Premium Caipirinha
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caipirinha Time

CNWBhhZlFt_9KVmS_5ig4A.text: The fam and I went for lunch on my 40th birthday, our experience put Fogo de Chao up to a solid 5 stars!  Lovin' the lunch here at Fogo!  Liked that the place wasn't that busy for a weekday lunch, as much as Fogo may not like it.  Because of this, the wait staff & servers were that much friendlier and that much more attentive.  Being pampered is kinda fun!  The food at Fogo is still on point, coming out as light-speed and still hot & tasty:  *Picanha *Beef Ancho (rib eye) *Alcatra (top sirloin) *Fraldinha (bottom sirloin) *Costela (beef ribs) - LOVE them, rich & fatty & beefy *Cordeiro (lamb chops) *Linguica (pork sausage) *Frango (chicken) *Garlic Mashed Potatoes *Caramelized Bananas *Pao de Queijo (cheese bread) - don't forget these!  And please, get your veggies in!  That Market Table of Fogo's has so many great salads and seasonal recipes - you almost don't need the meat!  ALMOST!  Oh, always ask for a side of their chimichurri!  Delicious with your meats!  After stuffing ourselves to the gills, carnevore-style - our waitress found out it was my birthday, and handed me the dessert menu...then told me to pick a treat of my choice, ON the HOUSE!  I ended up choosing the:  *Tres Leches Cake - soaked in 3 types of milk then topped with vanilla mousse and salted caramel dulce de leite  TASTY-ville!  Cake was moist & creamy, but wasn't too sweet at all.  Perfect ending to my special lunch!  Good food, good company, good service - really, what more can you ask for??  Can't wait for the next visit!  #beefy

lCmj7mw4kBs2G2__aQfEdA.text: Fogo de Chao Brazilian Steakhouse was the restaurant of choice for my friends birthday celebration and I thought it was absolutely amazing!   The location was awesome; the location was literally just off the strip, you don't have to worry bout driving because there is a spacious parking lot,  and they also offered valet! Yes ladies you can wear your favorite heels here and pull right up to the door!  Inside the ambiance was very romantic if you will allow me to explain. Dim lights, red hues, and round tables for more intimate conversation were abundant, but fear not, a level of intimacy was preserved. This would easily be on top of my list of restaurants for valentines or a special occasion.  To the real business; the food! The food was delicious. Everything was presented, seasoned, and cooked well! The temperatures, which is where we usually find an issue, we're actually spot on! This is hard to accomplish when the guests at your table enjoy temperatures ranging from rare to well!   My top two items remain the filet mignon, such tender little morsels, and the marinated mushrooms, a.k.a tangy buttons of love!

rhDqg6adfedEBOUHVdoWBw.text: I came here recently for a Yelp event and I thought the food was amazing! The salad bar is a little smaller than some places but I was fine with the side of mash potatoes for my meats. Meat and potatoes go great together and this left me with more room for their addicting cheesy rolls!   The meat is so tender and flavorful here! This is why I prefer Fogo de Chao over their competitors. I tried their beef, lamb, sausage and even chicken. Typically at these places I will skip over the chicken but I would suggest trying their chicken ...it has a great flavor to it! I love that the meats were succulent and not tough or gamey tasting.   I also  think they have stellar customer service here. The wait staff always comes by to make sure you are doing okay. My husband asked for some well done beef and two people came out with it! It's wonderful thing because in some places it's a struggle to even get your water refilled!  The decor and presentation of Fogo de Chao is very welcoming . They even have the name of their restaurant engraved on their cutlery . When they pay this much attention to detail it tells me that they not only care about the quality of the food but also of the experience they are providing to their patrons.
