V-EYaR-XQndRnQ8lb6MsMA.text: First Stop bar for drink and appetizer. Bartender Armando made a fantastic drink. I had spinach dip and it was fantastic. Due to lettuce recall was unable to have salad. My husband enjoyed the steak and more steak and more steak. Jose was our waiter and he did a great job.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HeDw7KLSdsEf3qJ7-OeXxA.text: Accept no imitations!!!! This is hands down the best Brazilian Steakhouse in Las Vegas. The quality of the meat is far better than other steakhouses. Not to mention, they season the meat much better (not overly salted like others) and use charcoal instead of gas. Service is also incredible. I truly felt that the staff cared about giving us a kind, attentive overall, enjoyable experience.  I'd like to give a particular thanks to the manager Tracy and his team. They were able to make my dinner even better by helping me to ask my brother to be the best man at my wedding. You all went above and beyond to make my night something to remember.   side note: my reservation was for a party of 7 at 7:30pm on 03/17...yes St. Patrick's day.

124WkgSyPkjhxNCBUHys_Q.text: We had a family wedding reception here and it was such a cool, unique experience that we've never had. The team of waiters who came around were awesome. Round one- you eat from the buffet- good selection. Round two- the team comes around with such a large amount of options of meats- lamb, sirloin, ribs, chicken, pork, sausages, and I'm certain I'm missing some. Each offered various amounts of 'done'- rare, medium, well- done. There is absolutely nothing like this that I know of in the Midwest. A must eat!

fCCikBYrG4z3C91xn4U3Rg.text: Absolutely love this restaurant we will be going back we went there for our anniversary and it was wonderful all of them Meats taste amazing and they were cooked perfectly this place deserves over five stars

7-EY6R40MZQcnCgKAi5snA.text: What a wonderful place! Not only is the staff helpful and attentive, but the food is amazing.  Upon entering, you are greeted with a salad and meat and cheese bar with a plethora of choices. You are also given a basket of cheese bread which is delicious. They are tiny rounds of bread mixed with cheese, giving it a dense, spongy texture with a crisp outer shell.   You are also given some side dishes to accompany the meats you will be given. You are given mashed potatoes (which was mediocre), but the sweetened plantains and fried polenta were delicious.  Now for the main event. My absolute favorite was the prime rib and filet mignon. I thought it was incredible that they could slice you a medium rare all the way to a medium well piece of meat from the same piece! I always opted for medium, and they were always a perfect cut. The meat was juicy and tender and flavorful. We also tried the short ribs and chicken, which also had tender meat. The pork tenderloin with parmesan was juicy and cut like butter. Now this is the section where I gave this restaurant a four instead of a five rating; some of the meats were salty. From the meats I had, the pork was the saltiest. And on only parts of the filet mignon (not the entire thing, odd enough), was salty. This made me not want to finish the meat because the saltiness was overpowering.  To end the wonderful meal, we had a slice of the Tres Leches cake, and wow. The cake was extremely moist and was sweet, but not too sweet.   Definitely an experience everyone should try. Amazing place!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres leaches, 5/5
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plantains and fried polenta, 4/5
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed potatoes, 3/5

v-KfHdjDX0SSuNtmsdVCLg.text: Took my family here after deciding to give this place another shot from a not so pleasant first experience. We had a reservation that required a high chair and were accommodated right away. We did not feel pressured by any upsales and had a delightful experience! We will definitely be back!

OI9l7ew3uxa2u5rUrogcvw.text: We have been to many Fogo De Chao restaurants, and love the one in DC.  So we were excited to bring friends.  It was so disappointing. Starting with the 30 + minute wait for our reservation beyond our reserved time.  Then, this is the LOUDEST restaurant in LV and that's saying a lot.  Then, the salad bar is sorely lacking compared to the others we've been to.  Really limited selections.  With the sides being white rice and black beans?  Then the meat - it just wasn't prepared as well as we are used to.  I ate very little and my friend ate like a bird.  The service - so so.  $400 later (including gratuity) we figured we could have gone to a really nice steakhouse and enjoyed it more.  So sorry that I cannot recommend.

Shwj_xPuLz9ax3SSd2eaIg.text: Different concept in all you can eat dining. That is - servers walk around to offer varieties, versus only a buffet style get up and get your own. But you still had to get up and get your own veggies, salads, soup, snack type cuts etc. Easy to get stuffed. So if you want to try most the served meats, limit your buffet plate fills.  First time to try Brazilian cuisine and if anything, I give 5 stars to the carved meat flavors. I don't care much for the flip coaster - green for 'yes more meat'. It was just another task to remember to do while enjoying a meal. Also, when we had the red flipped for no meat, it didn't work. The servers were happy to offer the roast on their large metal skewers regardless.  I don't eat this much meat ever, so the restaurant isn't one I'd dine often. It is a treat for protein eaters and recommend for those who diet this way. They serve everything for carnivores: chicken, pork, lamb, beef. My favorite flavors were the pork roast and NY cut, though these meats aren't my normal protein choices; I enjoyed them.  If you can't have fine dining without a cocktail, I suggest Brazilian Nights. It's like a martini, punches with the all savored ingredients. The sweet does pair well with the meat somehow; at least I thought so.  Nice place to celebrate any occasion. Location is off strip which makes parking easy. In addition, valet is complimentary! Nice interior, not too dim. They have a visible wine cellar. Service is constant. A table may have several servers. One was even super friendly to have a conversation with us; and we learned from each other - story tellers lounge kinda atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8GOJeiECxlLOySuS8hposQ.text: It has been a while and I couldn't believe it, but I think the service is even better than my last visit. The appetizer were great and the salad selections wonderful. Certainly one of the places I recommend to all of my friends. The price is extremely reasonable for the location and quality / quantity of what you receive.

Wj7jcE-XkQs8rszGeLvffA.text: This review will be short and to the point. In my opinion this place is not good at all. Went here for my sisters birthday dinner.  The meat was not seasoned, the salad bar left something to be desired.  The only good thing I had was the sangria and pineapple off of the salad bar.  This place charged more than Texas De Brazil and as  far as I am concerned Texas De Brazil has no competition!  Not sure why this place gets five stars on Yelp. Oh and btw the  servers were not great and the bathrooms were gross!

1mcRlzaa3eFfMp1nQ0lzhg.text: Ample amounts of amazing meats!   The service was spectacular as if they almost foreshadow I'm your needs.  The orchestration of shared responsibilities to keep the table well attendees was effortless and impressive.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bpEw4plT_70vFdsAJJ1fzQ.text: My husband and I came here for the Las Vegas Restaurant Week $40 dinner special last night and what a deal!  This was my first visit to Fogo and it left a great impression.  First of all, the $40 promotion to benefit Three Square Food Bank appealed to us because this dinner is usually about $20 more on the regular menu AND my husband needs that protein.  The Brazilian steakhouse experience is included, which means all access to the salad bar complete with soup, rice, black bean stew (feijoada), and more.  Sides are also all-you-can-eat ,which were that addicting cheese bread (pao de queijo), crispy polenta, mashed potatoes, and caramelized bananas.  The main course is the meat which includes most of the offerings on the regular menu for Restaurant Week except filet mignon and maybe one or two other meats.  However, we were quite satisfied with what we had with favorites being the Picanha (top sirloin) and Fraldinha (bottom sirloin).  Dessert choice for both of us was the Tres Leches cake, which we somehow had room for--delicious!  Service was quite attentive, especially for such a busy establishment.  You can't wrong with this kind of meal, especially if you are a carnivore, that also benefits a wonderful charity.  I'm sure we'll be back!

SPD9RON3d4Rg7L3dw-MuZw.text: Months ago my brother contacted Fogo Las Vegas Events (Ricci) Sales Manager, for our mom's 80th Birthday Bash for NYE... That ran smoothly with all the communications. The day of the reservation 12/31/18 was a HIT! We had a private room, that made the occasion even more intimate. This event was very special to us, and we are so pleased we chose Fogo for this venue! They had the perfect salad bar (aka the Market Table) with an array of vegetables, garnishes, soups, pasta, dozens of fresh fruits, cold meats and cheeses (I know I missed something). Oops I got distracted, as we all know, it's not just about the salad bar at Fogo de, I made sure I had enough room for more than a few helpings of meat! Oh! I've been here before, I made sure I took it easy on the Market Table! Fogo's entree's were juicy, flavorful, and perfectly cooked. Staff was great! They knew "green" card was keep it coming! So thanks Fogo de for covering all the basis on this special day for our mom's birthday! Communication was smooth and easy, Service was fantastic, Private room was perfect and thank you for allowing us to decorate for the occasion, and of course! The meal was delicious! I forgot about the desert! But my family loved it! Fantastico ....

cYDEwv71FFyS8qbciKo8Bg.text: Fogo de Chao is a chain, and this is one of the better restaurants I've found in the chain. We went on a weeknight when it was uncrowded but there was plenty of meat on offer. Meat is why you come here, of course. Smartly attired waiters carry huge skewers of grilled meats around the dining room, stopping at your table to offer them to you. Food of this quality and quantity isn't cheap... except when compared to basically everything on the Strip!

I3mcSWN0i7KJHMkSEN8piw.text: What can I write about fogo? Fogo de Chao is the best place to eat Quality food. This place is also very romantic, if one wishes to have a romantic dinner/lunch. Every choice of meat they offer is amazing. My all time favorite is the leg of lamb, its so perfectly cooked. It somehow become a tradition that every time I go to LV I must eat Fogo once. The best experience is to try it because honestly words cannot describe the amazing taste the food has.

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon

IJiG5xSDJnz9GlKUQAF2yg.text: I made a reservation for last night to celebrate our anniversary. I had included in the notes that it was our anniversary and when we arrived it seemed like every employee there knew it was our anniversary. The staff was fantastic and very attentive. Our service was excellent and the food was out of this world. For me, the Parmesan pork stole the show. It was delicious. My only knock on the whole evening was that the guys serving the beef options were hard to find. We had to have our waitress go find a couple of them and send them our way. The guys serving pork, lamb, chicken and sausage were at our table every time our coaster was green. Only saw the beef guys 2 times.  At the end of our meal they offered us a complimentary dessert, we chose the molten lava cake and it came out decorated for our anniversary and was a really nice touch. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our dinner. I highly recommend Fogo when you are in the mood for an awesome meal and experience.

QQfC-XWBtG0vLlmg-x-Mdg.text: If you are a meat lover, Fogo De Chao is the place to go. Meat is carved at your table and the salad bar has plentiful selections for various palates. Their wine and beer selections are extensive as well.  Service is extremely prompt and attentive and I and my wife enjoyed our Sunday brunch at Fogo. We will be back!

IgsAZ0wHZlHGiRfDxthrJw.text: Fantastic experience! Great food and excellent service. My wife and I look forward to coming again!

photos.caption: Photo of Fogo de Chão Brazilian Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fogo de Chão

D8mdtFw2Cd7mHG3rEBY9-Q.text: We made reservations on Christmas Eve for our small family of 3. We sat in a smaller dining area, separate from the large warmly lit room where the salad bar is located. It was very bright and very noisy, which detracted from the intimate family experience I was hoping for.  The premise here is you pay one price (on this holiday it was $56 each) for unlimited trips to the salad/antipasto bar, and gauchos walk around with a variety of wood-fired meats; you indicate if you want to try their offerings by turning over a red placard to green. There are also servers who check in at tables. As we were seated, a server asked if we wanted flat or sparkling water, not mentioning that it is not included in the price of dinner, so we paid an additional $8 for water. We were given side dishes at the table- potatoes, bread, plantains, and a shrimp cocktail- but again were not told the shrimp was an additional charge ($20!). The salad bar offerings are top-notch: marinated olives, prosciutto, fresh fruit. The gauchos offered chicken, pork sausage, flank steak, and lamb, all delicious- however, they didn't make it into our side room very often and my husband actually had to flag one down more than once. Also, the servers didn't check back very often- I waited quite a long time for them to notice our glasses were empty, and even longer for the check. Dessert is not included in the price, and I recommend if you choose to order, get one and share as they are very generous servings. It was very busy with large family celebrations, which probably explains the lack of attention, but for the price and atmosphere, I do have high expectations of service. Overall, this was a 3.5 experience.

GFjnDvEMk2cYwr5ft7K6YQ.text: I took my mom to Fogo for her birthday last week and boy was it good. The meat is to die for. So many selections. Each one was better than the last. Desserts were fantastic. They even gave my mom a free one for her birthday.  I'll be back.

3hO6Z1vyUxA3mez0lG5Waw.text: I write this with mixed feelings. I come here ever time I am in town and bring my team (5 years so far). The last time we went here for dinner, the staff tried to upsell us while we are having our meal. Does this mean the normal meat is not good? I cannot believe they did this to us while trying to enjoy our dinner. Will question if I take my team here on our next visit in Vegas in June.

rftlXPP3Zgx3_N62mqfCLg.text: I came here recently because I had a great experience at Texas de Brazil and I wanted to try another Brazilian steak house.  The meat here are very well cooked and comparable to Texas de Brazil. The only difference I found was that I felt like the meat here was a tad bit saltier which my girlfriend was really happy about.   My favorite item here was the beef rib just like at Texas de Brazil. The one thing that Texas has over fogo is their lobster bisque! However, I will come back again as we received a buy one get one free coupon when we recently came here!  Also, the service was awesome, I had no complaints!

pZNwvHK9LEwC8R-9CcM6AA.text: This is an update from the review I wrote a year ago after the Summerlin location closed down.  We've been back at least 3 times, once on New Year's and once on the evening before Easter.  It must've been a coincidence that on both times before I wrote that review, there were multiple wedding parties at the restaurant, taking up the salad bar.  Since that review, we've had ZERO problems with lines, even when it's busy on a holiday.  The service is exceptional and we have frequent stops from many different employees making sure we have what we need.  I am definitely updating my review to reflect their great service.

b2F4Y9OGRMVrgEZOAKNZXg.text: If you're on a paleo diet this is The perfect spot for you.  Plenty of cuts of meats and salad bar with cooked veggies steamed and grilled.  If you never been to an Brazilian steak house you my friend don't know how to be a foodie fanatic.  The cuts of meat are premium and cooked to your liking.  if it's not, they will take it , cook it more or less which ever you prefer.  The customer service is super attentive. We need more spot like this in Las Vegas. We they did a lunch special tho lol.

k6HqNAhYJf1qIHQCX4UKHw.text: Just okay to me. Not as good as Texas De Brazil. I like their salad bar options better, but the meats are LESS salty. Service is super friendly but they drag on refilling water.

clfogt8ZgjBwZmp7-91sZQ.text: It's definitely different than the one that I normally go to in San Diego. The lamb is different but it was still good. My only complaint is that as soon as we told the meat guy "No" once, the meats stopped coming. We had to ask for the meats we wanted at that point.

8r7h9yZMS8ZOfxwJH7Bu9g.text: Great place and service was excellent. Worth every penny. Will go again for sure. Gotta keep an eye on the red and green coaster. If it's green they don't hesitate.

XF7F605Kaeo1bFkeYhu0VA.text: Yummy! Where do I start? The meat selection is awesome! I loved the cheesy bread, mac and cheese anddd mashed potatoes! Definitely  food coma after this place. Only thing, I wish they had more options at the salad bar.

kCmQ279Qr2tUMHAaIPP9mw.text: The salad bar, the meats, the service was awesome.  The side dish of carmelized bananas was amazing as was the Pao de queijo.  This is a place I will return to next trip to Las Vegas

eKULtn4GPZEkFm-CS3iWpA.text: Wow. The food is always so good. Great service. Tracy always comes around to check on us and the staff always fills you up and makes sure you have everything you want. Thank you fogo de chao. A must when you stop in Vegas.

--DhtProxo4DnsipAARstw.text: We came here on thanksgiving and it's was kinda busy. We made reservation at 8pm and was on time.. my first time eat here, not my favorite. But my husband love it so much.. meat quality is very good. File wrap with bacon is my favorite and lamb chop too..

IoGCOwwCcQiCsZm0DZKTpA.text: Just enjoyed my Birthday lunch. I'm Stuffed to capacity. Always an Awesome Experience!

43SPxVedvey-9NCrhCdP8w.text: Rock on Vegas! Of course this was the full on Brazilian steakhouse experience. We went for lunch to attempt to keep the cost down... well worth the Uber off the strip. If you want to gorge yourself on steak, bananas, mashed potatoes, yucca and that awesome cheesebread... do so after the bountiful salad bar - cheese, soup, fresh greens, olives, fruit salad, spicy sausages - just for starters. We walked out just over a hundo.

2n8PP-Sm3vf2tcE0LrD4wA.text: Overrated place overall. Service goes straight 5 stars, yet the food is pretty disappointing. Good & bad about the food: Top and bottom sirloin cut is amazing, definitely 5 stars. Lamb chop and prime beef cut is of good quality as well, 4 stars for that. Lamb leg and prom ribs are bland. 2 stars, they could use more seasoning on those. Chicken leg is absolutely disgusting... seriously, I have never tasted any chicken leg worse than that.   Literally just an evenly cooked/salted drumstick, skip this one if you could. The whole buffet part is skippable as well, there is nothing really editable compared to their top notch steak cut. Uncleaned salad leaves and unpeeled pineapple cuts, wtf.  I am super speechless on everything else besides their super cuts. They have so many great materials  but sadly they don't know how to cook them well.

Lm6WAj3sKgfAiUenMzXv2Q.text: The food is always excellent and the customer service is top notch! Jose went above and beyond to make sure our table was taken care of. Will definitely be back soon, especially with Jose as our server.

RPvIvZX2DnWIl7UqsnnBmw.text: Attended a pharmaceutical dinner presentation.  Private room was very nice,  servers were extremely attentive. The 2- part meal began with the salad bar and then unending choices of meat on swords, brought to your table waiting to be carved for your delight. Might I add: Melt in your mouth steak! The dessert was fabulous.  Bring your appetite.  You're gonna need it!

d6kzT6_wAYhhwKLspFqIJg.text: Excellence as usual!!  Super eager staff that borderline on stfu leave me alone status.  I'm not talking about the meat peoples.  We just got way to many random "how's errrythings".  Nice I guess.  I enjoyed alllll the meats.  Especially the bacon wrapped filet.  They had some creative options also.  I like how each meat is cooked in various ways, well, medium, rare.  I'd def go here again!!

i8nFm7ZphX8iUikHpNle2g.text: I went here with friends who are all big meat eaters. I'm not, so ordered the ocean caught salmon, which was perfectly cooked, as would be expected for $43.  When one of my friends was seved sausage, I wanted a taste. The staff swept over to our table like I was stealing the Mona Lisa!   They instructed me that if I took even one bite of a sausage they would charge me an additional $51, as I would have crossed the menu into the prix fix meat side and have to pay for that option on top of my salmon.  I was glad to be made aware of their prix fix, but the ridigity seemed extreme for a restaurant that considers itself upscale.  I know of no other "upscale" restaurant in the US that treats it's customers so rudely... and serves it's butter in those cheapo little foil packets one sees at Denny's.

tEEVRIjDr0qoNHerI6SqxA.text: WARNING: COME HUNGRY!  If you think you're hungry, come hungrier. You can get filled so fast due to all the delicious meats you may scarf down in the first 30 mins (trust me, personal experience).   My boyfriend and I got seated fairly quickly upon walking in with no reservation. Our server hastily explained the process of the coasters to my boyfriend (first-timer). Red means no more meat, green means come at me with them (not kidding, they practically swarm you; can't think of any other heaven).   We quickly scurried to the salad bar to choose the different sides for the meats we were about to devour. I loved the range of selection, healthy and non-healthy. The veggies tasted very fresh. They also offered different vinaigrettes, oil, and condiments for our sides. Being Asian, we had rice our first round to eat with our meats but quickly changed it to all veggies (we're clearly new to this).  Now onto the food itself: Can I please just first talk about the mashed potatoes that they brought out as a side. They were the FLUFFIEST clouds of heaven I've ever tasted in my near 23 years of life. They practically melted in my mouth. I was so taken aback by the potatoes I immediately placed half of it on my own plate. The cheeseballs deserve a shoutout too. The cheese wasn't prominent visually but definitely evident tastefully. They were SO airy, it was just delightful. I loved tearing it in pieces and looking at the insides. I felt like a child eating those wonderful cheese balls. My favorite meats were the filet mignon wrapped in bacon and the top sirloin. I liked that you can request particular meats and it will come out right away. I also like that they ask how you liked your meat cooked. Some meats came out a lot more rare than my requested medium rare, but it was still delicious.  The meat servers were pretty nice, some made jokes which was pleasant. The service speed can be a bit better. I had to ask a few times for my A1 sauce (I know I shouldn't ask for a sauce, but I can't resist A1 sauce no matter how good the meat is). We had to wait a bit for our cups to be refilled as well. This may be due to how busy they were so it's not a big deal.  All in all, this was a pleasant experience with a wonderful array of meats and vegetables to choose from. I will definitely be back to celebrate special occasions!
